alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 9:53PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Hartford and far southwestern Hampden Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 951 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms clustered over Southington to Meriden, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Hail up to penny size, brief downpours and occasional cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy downpours may cause poor drainage flooding where water does not drain as well. Locations impacted include... New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Southington, Westfield, Newington, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Avon, Plainville, Suffield, Granby, Canton, Southwick, Burlington, East Granby, Hartland and Russell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
